tuv.seg: The Blind Welfare Allowance is a means-tested payment from the Health Service Executive (HSE) to people who are blind or visually impaired
Is é atá i Liúntas na Dall ná íocaíocht tástáilte ó thaobh acmhainne ó Fheidhmeannacht na Seirbhíse Sláinte (FSS) do dhaoine atá dall nó ar lagamharc
The allowance is paid to eligible people from 18 years of age
Íoctar an liúntas le daoine incháilithe atá 18 bliana d’aois nó níos sine
You may qualify for Blind Welfare Allowance if you:
D'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh tú i dteadeal Liúntas Leasa na nDall má tá:
• Are getting Blind Pension from the Department of Social Protection
• Tú ag fáil Pinsean na nDall ón Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí

• Are getting an income maintenance payment from the Department of Social Protection, or an equivalent type social security payment from another country, and have a certificate of visual impairment from an ophthalmologist

• Íocaíocht chothabhála ioncaim á fáil agat ón Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí nó a chomhionann de shaghas d’íocaíocht slándála sóisialaí ó thír eile agus deimhniú um lagú amhairc a bheith agat ó oftailmeolaí
• Have an income below the combined Blind Pension rate and Blind Welfare Allowance rate and have a certificate of visual impairment from an ophthalmic surgeon
• Ioncam a bheith agat atá faoi bhun chomhráta Phinsean na nDall agus ráta Liúntas Leasa na nDall agus deimhniú um lagú amhairc a bheith agat ó oftailmeolaí

To qualify for Blind Welfare Allowance, your vision must have "best vision equal to or less than 6/60 in the better eye or if the field of vision is limited, the widest diameter of vision subtending an angle of not greater than 20 degrees"

Chun Liúntas Leas na nDall a fháil, ní mór duit “radharc na súl is fear a bheith cothrom le nó níos lú ná 6/60 sa tsúil is fearr nó má tá raon an radhairc teoranta, nach mbeadh an trastomhas is leithne ag gabháil uillinn níos mó ná 20 céim”

This can be confirmed by a certificate of visual acuity from your ophthalmic surgeon or by a letter from the National Council for the Blind of Ireland (NCBI), who can confirm whether you meet the criteria to register as blind

Is féidir seo a dheimhniú ag deimhniú um ghéire amhairc ó do mháinlia oftalmach nó ag litir ó Chomhairle Náisiúnta na hÉireann do na Daill (CNÉD), ar féidir leo a dheimhniú cibé acu an gcomhlíonann nó nach gcomhlíonann tú na critéir chun clárú amhail bheith dall
People do not have to be meet this registration criteria in order to use the services of NCBI
Ní gá do dhaoine na critéir chlárúcháin seo a chomhlíonadh chun úsáid a bhaint as seirbhísí an CNÉD
You cannot get Blind Welfare Allowance if you are in a long-term residential care facility
Ní féidir leat Liúntas na nDall a fháil má tá tú i saoráid cúraim chónaithe fhadtéarmaigh
However, if you are admitted into a residential care facility you can keep your Blind Welfare Allowance for a maximum of 8 continuous weeks in any 12 month period
Má ghlactar isteach i saoráid cúraim chónaithe tú, áfach, is féidir leat Liúntas na nDall a choinneáil ar feadh 8 seachtaine leanúnach ar a mhéad in aon tréimhse 12 mhí
The weekly rate for Blind Welfare Allowance is:
Faoi láthair íoctar na rátaí seo a leanas do Liúntas Leasa na nDall:
• €58.50 for a single person
• €58.50 sa tseachtain do dhuine singil
• €117.00 for a blind couple
• €117.00 sa tseachtain do lánúin atá dall
• €4.40 for each child dependant
• €4.40 sa tseachtain ar son gach páiste chleithiúnaigh
The Blind Welfare Allowance rate for a couple is only applicable where both the applicant and partner/spouse are blind or visually impaired and qualify for the allowance
Íoctar an ráta do Liúntas Leasa na nDall do lánúin nuair atá an bheirt - an t-iarrthóir agus an páirtí/céile cáilithe lena aghaidh
Apply to your Local Health Office for the Blind Welfare Allowance
Cuir iarratas ar Liúntas Leasa na nDall chuig d'Oifig Sláinte Áitiúil
If you consider that you have been wrongly refused Blind Welfare Allowance you can appeal the decision using the HSE appeals process
Má shíleann tú gur diúltaíodh Liúntas Leasa na nDall duit go héagórach, tá an rogha agat achomharc a thabhairt in aghaidh an chinnidh sin
